userreviews.userReview: Chocolate River Rescue is a fast, exciting geronimo down a well-greased water slide. The story deals with the adventures of Tony, Craig, Shawn and Petra as they try to escape from an ice floe that is being dragged out to the open sea by the fierce tidal current of the Peticodiack River. The book is based on a true story and is a real page-turner. From the first chapter onwards the reader will find themselves caught up in a breathless adventure that begs to be read at a single go.yours in storytelling,Steve Vernon
This was a fabulous read-aloud to grade four students :)

A fantastic book....the students were on the edge of their seats listening and wondering what was going to happen next. Fantastic descriptive writing, made us feel like we were there, living this adventure as well. My students loved that it took place in NB.

this book is very good but some of it wasn't so clear so the reason i gave it a 2/5 star was because it was very different from all of the other books i have read in the past. This book should have had much more thought to it. In my opinion i think this book should have been longer.
amazing story and how it can actually happen to anyone
I used this book in a classroom setting. The storyline was fast-moving but not overly complicated. The setting was interesting and non-fictional. A great story for my class.

description: Shawn Mahoney and Tony Steeves, both ten, and Shawn's younger brother, Craig, eight, are trapped on an ice floe and speeding down Chocolate River. They are quickly spotted by a passerby, who calls 911 and sets the police and fire departments in motion. What ensues is a complicated and dangerous rescue mission. The water is moving fast, and it will be terribly difficult to intercept the boys at the right point on the river. If they float all the way out to sea, they could be lost forever.
title: Chocolate River Rescue
